headline.main: News Direct from the Utah Expedition.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Independence Messenger, of Saturday, mentions the arrival there of three men direct from Camp Scott. They reported that the troops were in good health, but that provisions were scarce, with the exception of poor beef. Gen. JOHNSON would not be able to move forward until a fresh supply of animals was received.

docs.abstract: End of the Seminole war - surrender of Billy Bowlegs and his men
docs.lead_paragraph: We obtain some further intelligence of interest from our files by the Vanderbilt, which arrived at this port at an early hour yesterday morning London journals received are to the 2S,h ult., inclusive. The debate in the House of Commons on the new Government of India bill, appointed to take place on the 30th, was looked forward to with much interest.

docs.snippet: A NEW ALTERED BILL.--Okes altered to tens on the New-York Bank, made their appearance in the City yesterday morning. The alteration Is skillfully made. Information of the fact was communicated to the Police head-quarters, and notices sent by...
docs.lead_paragraph: A NEW ALTERED BILL.--Okes altered to tens on the New-York Bank, made their appearance in the City yesterday morning. The alteration Is skillfully made. Information of the fact was communicated to the Police head-quarters, and notices sent by telegraph to the Police to put storekeepers on their guard. One arrest has been made of a person offering these bills in Canal-street.

docs.snippet: A dispatch from Independence announces the arrival there of Mr. MASON. He left Camp Scott March 3. The news he brought was unimportant. General JOHNSON was anxiously awaiting the arrival of Capt. MARCY. The health of the army was remarkably good....

headline.main: The Utah Expedition.; INTERESTING FROM CAMP SCOTT--CONTINUED GOOD HEALTH OF THE TROOPS--SCARCITY OF PROVISIONS, ETC.

docs.lead_paragraph: A dispatch from Independence announces the arrival there of Mr. MASON. He left Camp Scott March 3. The news he brought was unimportant. General JOHNSON was anxiously awaiting the arrival of Capt. MARCY. The health of the army was remarkably good. Provisions were becoming scarce, but supplies were expected from Fort Laramie.

docs.snippet: Major-General SMITH has issued elaborate orders relative to the movement of the trains and troops of the Utah forces. The trains are to be divided into divisions of two hundred and twenty-six wagons each. and the troops will be organized into...

headline.main: Movements of Trains and Troops for Utah.

docs.lead_paragraph: Major-General SMITH has issued elaborate orders relative to the movement of the trains and troops of the Utah forces. The trains are to be divided into divisions of two hundred and twenty-six wagons each. and the troops will be organized into columns, each column constituting the escort of a division. A general supply train, and the first column, under command of Lieut.-Col. ANDREWS, are already organized, and ordered to march.

docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New- York Times: In your article headed " City Market Property," contained in your paper of the 7th inst., you state: " And the developments in regard to the management of our City markets offer another very striking illustration...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New- York Times: In your article headed " City Market Property," contained in your paper of the 7th inst., you state: " And the developments in regard to the management of our City markets offer another very striking illustration of the incapacity which presides over the financial department of the City Goverement."

docs.snippet: In the Senate, yesterday, Mr. MASON presented the credentials of the Hon. THOMAS L. CLINGMAN, appointed a Senator from North Carolina, by the Governor of that State, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of the Hon. ASA BIGGS. Mr. BIGGS was...
docs.abstract: Arrested as a poisoner. Committed Suicide
docs.lead_paragraph: In the Senate, yesterday, Mr. MASON presented the credentials of the Hon. THOMAS L. CLINGMAN, appointed a Senator from North Carolina, by the Governor of that State, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of the Hon. ASA BIGGS. Mr. BIGGS was appointed the other day United States District Judge.

docs.snippet: Mr. MASON, of Virginia, presented the credentials of Mr. CLINGMAN, as Senator from North Carolina in place of Mr. BIGGS. In consequence of the death of Senator EVANS, of South Carolina, the Senate immediately adjourned. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES....

headline.main: XXXVth CONGRESS.....First Session.; SENATE. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. MASON, of Virginia, presented the credentials of Mr. CLINGMAN, as Senator from North Carolina in place of Mr. BIGGS. In consequence of the death of Senator EVANS, of South Carolina, the Senate immediately adjourned. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES. WASHINGTON, Friday, May 7.

docs.snippet: Criminal proceedings were instituted yesterday against ABRAHAM D. RUSSELL, City Judge, BERNARD ULLMAN, Lessee and Manager of the Academy of Music, and five men acting as officers of the Court of Sessions, for their alleged illegal action connected...

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Late Difficulty at the Academy of Music Affidavits taken before the Mayor-A Warrant Issued for the Arrest of the City Judge, CONTEMPLATED ARREST OF CITY JUDGE RUSSELL. Eating Dead Rats and Dead Cats--Eccentricities and Consequent Persecuton of a Rag-Picker. PROBABLE FATAL FIGHT BETWEEN TWO CAULKERS.--Charles Heath and Owen McCoy, two caulkers, West Washington Market Proceedings. Police Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: Criminal proceedings were instituted yesterday against ABRAHAM D. RUSSELL, City Judge, BERNARD ULLMAN, Lessee and Manager of the Academy of Music, and five men acting as officers of the Court of Sessions, for their alleged illegal action connected with the recent arrest at the Academy of Music, of Mr. GEORGE WILKES, Editor of Porter's Spirit of the Times, and Mr. JOHN DARCIE, the musical and dramatic critic of the paper.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Anniversary of some of the important Benevolent Societies commences to-morrow. The Rev. Dr. ANTHON preaches before the New-York Bible Society in the Rev. Dr. TYNG'S Church; the Rev. Dr. SHAW, of Rochester, preaches before the Ameriican Home Missionary Society in the Rev. Dr. CHEEVER'S Church: and the Rev. Dr. MCDONALD,
